context: In August 2005, Houston became a shelter to more than <a0_0><b5_0>150,000<b5_0/><a0_0/> people from New Orleans who evacuated from Hurricane Katrina. One month later, approximately 2.5 million Houston area residents evacuated when <a1_0><b6_0>Hurricane Rita<b6_0/><a1_0/> approached the Gulf Coast, leaving little damage to the Houston area. This was the <a2_0><b7_0>largest urban evacuation<b7_0/><a2_0/> in the history of the United States. In <a3_0><b8_0>September 2008<b8_0/><a3_0/>, Houston was hit by Hurricane Ike. As many as <a4_0><b9_0>forty percent<b9_0/><a4_0/> refused to leave Galveston Island because they feared the traffic problems that happened after Hurricane Rita.
